text: Hi all, I have an idea, but didn't know if someone else had done it so I don't have to recreate it, or if it's a brand new idea.  We've been running into an issue where closed - won deals are occuring without an associated contact record. This in turn prevents those contacts from enrolling into automated workflows that are related to their recently closed deal. Is there a way to use a Deal to Contact <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-associations/crm-associations-overview>, and combine it with this code <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-associations/get-associations> to find a saved email on the deal record (we save a signor's email address to the deal) on a contact record and associate the two objects along with adding the association label?

Also, because I figured check the existing HS libary, I was wondering about this and if this might be a great place to start with implementing such code <https://github.com/HubSpot/sample-workflow-custom-code/blob/main/samples/associate_contact_deals_to_company.js>
<@U0594PYFME2> how do you know what contact needs to be assigned to that closed deal?
<@U03REFNRMB3> we'll save a "signor email" address (required at the quote accepted stage in our pipeline). I'm thinking we could use that to search against email fields in contacts
where is the deal coming from? automations or manual?

At this time it's a manual update (we have a separate software that we tried integrating with api, but it was causing more problems than solutions), and with how sometimes incorrect information is placed on the record until that quote accepted stage.

I'll draft up a custom code action to help you <@U0594PYFME2> 

If you want a better solution! I know someone! :wink:
